Special Permission Required
No

Description:

This course builds on the Principles of Economics course. It focuses on the following topics: theory of the consumer, theory of the producer, perfectly competitive market equilibrium, imperfect competition, and market failures due to asymmetric information such as adverse selection and moral hazard. (Lecture, 3 hours; Recitation, 1 hour).

Prerequisites
(21256 or 21259 or 21269 or 21268 or 21254) and (73100 or 73102 or 73104)
Corequisites
None
Cross-Listed Courses
None
Notes
NOTE ABOUT WAITLISTS: During the first week of registration, all seats in b usiness and economics courses are reserved for Tepper primary majors. Start ing week two of registration, the Tepper School begins to enroll students f rom the waitlist. Priority is given to Tepper additional majors and minors and by class level (senior, junior, sophomore, first year). Waitlists are m anaged on a regular basis through the University add deadlines.
